item.title: Degraded performance due to spike of requests
item.content:encoded:
Feb 8, 14:19 CET
Resolved - This incident has been resolved.

Feb 8, 14:19 CET
Update - We have mitigated the root cause and worked on preventions in our publicly available API. All systems have been instantiated into fully operational state.

Feb 8, 14:17 CET
Update - We are continuing to monitor for any further issues.

Feb 8, 12:11 CET
Update - As mitigation measure, we disabled our public api which was the main trigger of the query. This ensures us that all other services are running as expected.

Feb 8, 11:30 CET
Monitoring - We have identified and through identification immediately applied a fix. We are observing the system now in its performance. It was a single query which has supposedly led to a sudden unexpected occupation of the database related to product variation updates. The engineering team is working on a prevention plan now.

Feb 8, 11:26 CET
Investigating - We have a spike in requests and that may make the platform appear being down. This is related to just very slow responses and we are investigating.

item.title: Platform inaccessible
item.content:encoded:
Dec 5, 08:50 CET
Resolved - The rollback has been fully released. We have observed no further errors.

Dec 5, 08:01 CET
Monitoring - We have released the fix to production. Some of our microservices are still affected, but they are not affecting the platform immediately and will be release the next 1 hour.

Dec 5, 07:56 CET
Identified - We've identified the root cause: an update to our internal ISO27001 daily patching procedure conflicted with our current database connection setup. We've thoroughly tested this in our pre-production environment and are now rolling back the driver patch on our production system. Thanks for your patience.

Dec 5, 07:18 CET
Investigating - We are currently investigating the issue. We have logs that no query against our database can be executed, because of a timezone problem.

Investigating - .
At 5:50AM UTC the system shipped internally-designed emails to customers.
> The content of the email did not contain any sensitive or confidential information.

At 5:58AM UTC, as a precaution, we shut down the email-service to avoid further email being shipped out.
As a consequence, logging in with the email is now disabled.

We are now investigating the root cause
